title: Astronauts, breast milk and chewed gum: Being Human – in pictures
text:
Minds and bodies Latai, No Human Being Is Illegal (in all our glory), Deborah Kelly and collaborators, 2014-18. The Sydney-based artists presents a work from her series of 20 lifesize portraits. Volunteers were photographed naked and asked what they wanted people to know about them. A different work from Kelly’s resulting series of collages will be put on display each year during the lifespan of the new gallery. The complete set has been newly acquired by Wellcome Collection

Photograph: Deborah Kelley and collaborators/Wellcome Collection
description: Being Human, a new permanent gallery at Wellcome Collection in London, explores what it means to be human in the 21st century
